data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you' re facing forward, you always face upwards. Forward steps are taken forward. Forward steps are taken forward. Backward steps are taken backwards. So, the answer is No.

You turn around and turn around and turn. You can't turn left and right in the same direction. So, the answer is No.

If you start back where you started, you would not take the extra 6 steps to return. You would take 8 steps to return. So, the answer is Yes.

This is the order in which you would go forward in directions. It is when one moves towards where you are starting to take actions. So, the answer is Yes.

Steps forward are always taken at a straight line with your feet next to you. Steps backward are taken at the same angle as the steps forward. So, the answer is No.

The starting step can only be found in the order shown in step 1 of the diagram. If you are going to the starting point, you should always face forward. If you are going backward, you should always take 10 steps forward. These are the exact order for taking steps backward. So, the answer is No.
